agenda.description: SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Natural Resources & Economic Development TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Wednesday, April 24, 2019 PLACE: E1.012 (Hearing Room) CHAIR: Senator Brian Birdwell HB 1953 Thompson, Ed SP: Hancock Relating to the conversion of plastics and other recoverable materials through pyrolysis or gasification. HB 2675 Geren SP: Birdwell Relating to the repeal of the provisions providing for the suspension of the collection of certain fees when the balance in the oil and gas regulation and cleanup fund exceeds a specified amount. HB 2714 Bailes | et al. SP: Birdwell Relating to the registration of liquefied petroleum gas container manufacturers and the regulation of liquefied petroleum gas licensees; authorizing fees. HB 3226 Geren | et al. SP: Birdwell Relating to the terms of dissolution of an oil or gas pooled unit. HB 3246 Darby | et al. SP: Hancock Relating to the treatment and recycling for beneficial use of certain waste arising out of or incidental to the drilling for or production of oil or gas. SB 950 Kolkhorst | et al. Relating to the definition of a commercial hazardous waste management facility. SB 1400 Campbell | et al. Relating to the location and maintenance of the Alamo Cenotaph; granting the power of eminent domain. Public testimony will be limited to 2 minutes. If submitting written testimony, you must include your name or the name of your organization on each copy, and you must likewise email a digital copy to the clerk of the committee.
